Something I've been working on and here's the first result. This is a stock contraption. For a race, vehicles need one mod: mechjeb. The rover autopilot keeps it driving in the right direction. I'll upload the craft file later after some more testing. And I'll make a video at some point.

I haven't implemented anything else yet. Ideas?

How it works: I decouple both vehicles and let them roll to the moveable ramp. Set rover pilot to 090. Full throttle on both. Then I press AG 9 for the yellow lights. When I press AG 8 the lights switch to green and the ramp lowers.

Anyway, here are some pictures of my own stock race.

Welcome ladies and gentlemen for the first official real time duel drag race in KSP!                                            (I think)

On this beautiful and shiny day we have the first two warriors. On the left is the famous Dodge Charger R/T from 1969. On the right the Dodge Challenger R/T 1971. They're roughly equal in mass and both have 4 Hemi Juno engines.

There's the green light! They're off!

The Challenger is taking the lead!

People this is crazy! What a race! The reporter next to me has fainted out of excitement!

Look at that! The Charger has decided it's his turn!

There he goes! Goodbye Challenger!

As always, a Charger is hard to beat!

A tiny dot in the mirror! The Challenger is going to need a jumbo sized box of Kleenex!

Hey come on, it's a general, not an admiral!

The Challenger wanted to see if it could become a Barracuda ... it's gotta learn how to reach the water first!

Hey, that's brilliant, although would it be anything else coming from 77Industries     With all the racing  going on right now I was thinking along the same lines too. Are you thinking  of a hosted type king of the hill challenge? With the races being run and set up by one person, with a video record perhaps, a good op for people with camera tools skills I'd think.  How would the timing be worked,? would it be first across the line?  or on  mission clock record, what i mean by this is  perhaps have some object that each vehicle would collide with at the end of the run and thereby show a destruction event in the F3 view,  this would probably remove some of the inevitable photo finishes that would arise

Although my stock Foo is spectacularly poor I'd be up for a shot . I'll take it as read coming from the King of stock builds that it would and will be a stock only event,  which is just as it should be

Right now I'm installing signs and lines at 1/8, 1/4 and 1/2 mile, easy to aim camera on. With physics delta-t set to 0.02 it's easy to hammer on F1 and make a lot of screens for a perfect photo finish :-)

A real timer would be awesome but I'm not sure how that would be possible. Maybe a big wall isn't such a bad idea ;-)

Due to lots of images the next story can be found in the spoiler.

 

Spoiler

Our next race is between the Charger R/D (Road/Dirt) and the Star Racer YKR. That YKR looks fast! It's going to beat that Charger for sure! What do you think, Ralph?

Well Giles ... I don't know about this one. The YKR is built for high speed that's for sure but it's only got 6 Juno's. The R/D has 8 of them. Maybe at the 1/2 mile but I'm betting the Charger is going to win the 1/8 and 1/4.

 

They're ready to go! Yellow lights! Are you going to faint again, Ralph?

Well Giles ... I've done some yoga so I think I'll be okay.

They're off! Amazing! The Charger is taking the lead in the first few yards!

Well Giles ... I told you so.

Past the 1/8 line, the YKR is nowhere to be seen!

And that was the 1/4 line! Amazing!

Ohw no! The Charger crashed into the 1/2 sign! You see Valentina ... or what's left of her, flung out the back of the car!

Well Giles ... what kind of idiot places markers in the middle.

Ralph, they're supposed to drive in a straight line. Blame mechjeb. Drivers need to set the autopilot to 90.5 or 91 degrees.

Yep, that little dust cloud ... that was Valentina. Looks like the YKR was already gaining on the R/D when the accident happened. Let's try again.

Well Giles, I think that would be interesting.

 

Wow! What a start! Again the R/D takes the lead with ease!

The R/D wins the 1/8, 1/4 and 1/2 in both runs. But hey look at that YKR! It's zooming past with incredible speed!

Well Giles, I wasn't totally right because I expected the YKR the win the 1/2. But this is impressive!

You don't have to do that all the time, Ralph. Hey, look where they're going!

Well Giles ... this isn't looking good.

The YKR just smashed itself to bits beyond the end of the runway! What a disaster! And the R/D is heading straight for the runway light!

Well Giles ... seems like we'll have another two funerals in a second.

Thank you captain obvious. And stop doing that.

Let's have a moment of silence.

It's amazing ladies and gentlemen! Steve Kerman survived the impact! We have reports from the sea that the wreck of the YKR is found. No-one could have survived what happened. His name was Utger Kerman.

Well Giles ... miracles do exist.

Well Ralph ... seems I'm going to have a different co-host for the next race.

What do you mean Giles?

You're fired.

Power conversion looks at follows:

Supercharger: IntakeAir + Torque = CompressedAir -> Cylinder: Nitromethane + CompressedAir = Torque + ExhaustGas (and a lot of heat) -> ExhaustStack/Wheels.

I'm still busy with balancing, might take a while until I'm satisfied. I'm not calculating anything so it takes time.
